module.name: LCLIntf
module.short: Contains winapi like functions for Delphi compatibility.

descr.p: This unit was created for Delphi compatibility. It contains selected functions from the Delphi Windows unit, which finally are implemented in the widgetsets.

For LCL users:
The functions can be used to make porting of Delphi applications easier, and are not 100% emulating winapi functions, not even under windows. They were implemented and tested with some common Delphi libraries. The LCL contains many extra functions that the Delphi VCL does not have.
descr.remark: Some functions are not exactly Delphi or WinAPI compatible.
descr.p:
For example:
Instead of using the common windows functions SaveDC and RestoreDC use the Canvas.SaveHandleState and Canvas.RestoreHandleState. [really? where's an according map?]

element.name: Arc
element.short: Draws an elliptical curve.

descr.p: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen.

[this looks outdated?] The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360). Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction.
Zero degrees is at the 3'o clock position (right).

element.name: Arc.Angle16Deg
element.short: The starting angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: AngleChord
element.short: Draws a filled Chord described by two angles.

descr.p: AngleChord is a Lazarus addition, similar to the Windows API Chord, but uses angles to control the location of the chord inside the ellipse instead of two points like the Windows API Chord.

A Chord is a section of an ellipse between two angles (angle1 and angle2), closed by a straight line (secant). It's equivalent to a Pie without the triangle between the arc and the center of the ellipse.
The curve part of the chord is defined by the ellipse which fits in the bounding rectangle specified by the coordinates x1, y1, x2 and y2.
The Chord is outlined by the current Pen and filled with the current Brush.

element.name: AngleChord.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: AngleChord.angle1
element.short: The starting angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: AngleChord.angle2
element.short: The ending angle in 1/16 degrees, starting right and continuing counter-clockwise.

element.name: BeginPaint
element.short: Start painting in a window.

descr.p: This function is for use in WM_PAINT handlers only. Not all platforms allow for painting outside WM_PAINT messages.
BeginPaint prepares the specified window for painting and fills a PAINTSTRUCT structure with information about the painting.

element.name: BeginPaint.Result
element.short: A Device Context for the window, Nil on failure.

element.name: BeginPaint.Handle
element.short: The window Handle.

element.name: BeginPaint.PS
element.short: Will receive painting information.

element.name: BitBlt
element.short: Copies a section of a Canvas to another one, performing a raster operation (ROP).

descr.p: This routine implements the equivalent Windows GDI API of the same name in all platforms supported by Lazarus. It copies a section of a Canvas to another one, without any stretching. It allows to select the kind of operation which should be performed to draw the pixels into the destination in the parameter ROP. Allowed operations go from simply copying the pixels without change to inverting them and also to executing logical operations involving the source pixels and the previously existing pixels in the destination Canvas.
For normal usage one should only use SRCOPY in the ROP parameter, other operations may not be supported by all widgetsets.
There exist 16 raster operations, according to the possible combinations of two (boolean) values. Excluding the NOP case, that doesn't modify the target area, the possible values for ROP are:

ul.li: BLACKNESS - Fills the destination rectangle with black
DSTINVERT - Inverts the colors of the destination area
SRCPAINT - Combines the colors of the source and the destination using the operator OR on each pixel
WHITENESS - Fills the destination rectangle with white

descr.p: These flags can be added to above ROPs:

ul.li: CAPTUREBLT - Includes windows which are on top of the specified Canvas. This option is not recommended and is very hard to implement in all supported platforms.
NOMIRRORBITMAP - Prevents the bitmap from being mirrored. (The coordinates are sorted before painting?)

element.name: BitBlt.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: BitBlt.DestDC
element.short: The destination Device Context.

element.name: BitBlt.X
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Y
element.short: The origin in the destination DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Width
element.short: The image size.

element.name: BitBlt.Height
element.short: The image size.

element.name: BitBlt.SrcDC
element.short: The source Device Context.

element.name: BitBlt.XSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: BitBlt.YSrc
element.short: The origin in the source DC.

element.name: BitBlt.Rop
element.short: The raster operation.

element.name: CallNextHookEx
element.short: Calls the next procedure in the hook chain.
element.descr: Useless without SetWindowsHookEx(). [How to install an system Hook?]

element.name: CallNextHookEx.Result
element.short: Depends on the Hook type.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.hhk
element.short: Handle of the current hook.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.ncode
element.short: The Hook code (message ID).

element.name: CallNextHookEx.WParam
element.short: Message parameter.

element.name: CallNextHookEx.LParam
element.short: Message parameter.

element.name: CallWindowProc
element.short: Calls another Window procedure, to handle a message.

element.name: ClientToScreen
element.short: Converts (relative) Client coordinates into absolute Screen coordinates.

element.name: ClientToScreen.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: ClientToScreen.Handle
element.short: The window with the client area.

element.name: ClientToScreen.P
element.short: The point to convert.

element.name: CombineRgn
element.short: Combines two regions.

descr.pre: The following parameters are present in this function: Dest - The Handle of a region which will receive the result of the operation Src1 - One of the two regions to combine Src2 - The other region to combinee fnCombineMode - The method to use to combine the regions. As for the parameter fnCombineMode, the following constants from the unit LCLType can be used: RGN_AND - The result is the intersection of the two combined regions. RGN_COPY - The result is a copy of the region Src1 RGN_DIFF - Combines the parts of Src1 that are not part of Src2. RGN_OR - The result is the union of the two regions. RGN_XOR - The result is the union of two combined regions except for any overlapping areas.

element.name: CombineRgn.Dest
element.short: The Handle of the destination region. This region must already exist!

element.name: CombineRgn.Src1
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: CombineRgn.Src2
element.short: The handle of a region to combine.

element.name: CombineRgn.fnCombineMode
element.short: How the regions are combined.

element.name: CreateBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap object.

element.name: CreateBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateBitmap.Planes
element.short: The number of color planes.

element.name: CreateBitmap.BitCount
element.short: The number of color bits per pixel and plane.

element.name: CreateBitmap.BitmapBits
element.short: The bitmap pixels. Scanlines must be word-aligned.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect
element.short: Creates a brush object (bitmap).
element.descr: A brush is used to fill image areas (background...). It has a color and a pattern, e.g. BS_SOLID.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect.Result
element.short: The brush Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateBrushIndirect.LogBrush
element.short: Description of the brush.

element.name: CreateCaret
element.short: Creates a Caret (text cursor).
element.descr: This description is taken from the WinAPI, no guarantee for other platforms.

element.name: CreateCaret.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: CreateCaret.Handle
element.short: The window that owns the caret.

element.name: CreateCaret.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap Handle, or zero for a solid (black) caret, 1 for a grey caret.

element.name: CreateCaret.width
element.short: The width of the caret, in logical units.

element.name: CreateCaret.Height
element.short: The height of the caret, in logical units.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap
element.short: Creates a bitmap that is compatible with the given DC.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.DC
element.short: The Device Context for the bitmap.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Width
element.short: The bitmap width in pixels.

element.name: CreateCompatibleBitmap.Height
element.short: The bitmap height in pixels.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC
element.short: Creates an memory Device Context, compatible with the device of the given DC.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC.Result
element.short: The memory DC, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateCompatibleDC.DC
element.short: The device DC.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap
element.short: Creates a Device Dependent Bitmap (DDB) from a Device Independent Bitmap (DIB).

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.Result
element.short: The bitmap handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.DC
element.short: The context for the DDB.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InfoHeader
element.short: The bitmap info header.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InitBits
element.short: An array containing the bitmap pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBitmap.InitInfo
element.short: CBM_INIT when InitBits contains valid data, else zero.[?]

element.name: CreateDIBSection
element.short: Creates a bitmap into which the application can write.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Result
element.short: The bitmap Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.DC
element.short: The DC for the bitmap.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.BitmapInfo
element.short: Contains all information about the bitmap, except the pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Usage
element.short: The type of the bitmap colors, e.g. DIB_RGB_COLORS.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Bits
element.short: Pointer to the bitmap pixels.

element.name: CreateDIBSection.SectionHandle
element.short: Zero or the Handle of a file-mapping object, from which the bitmap is initialized (needs CreateFileMapping).

element.name: CreateDIBSection.Offset
element.short: The offset to the bitmap bits in the file-mapping object.

element.name: CreateEllipticRgn
element.short: Creates an elliptic region.

element.name: CreateEllipticRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect
element.short: Creates an logical font, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirect.LogFont
element.short: The font description.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx
element.short: Creates an logical font, selectable into any DC. Allows for an long fontname.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.Result
element.short: The font handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.LogFont
element.short: The font description.

element.name: CreateFontIndirectEx.LongFontName
element.short: The font name, can be longer than 32 characters.

element.name: CreateIconIndirect
element.short: Creates an icon or cursor.

element.name: CreateIconIndirect.Result
element.short: The Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePalette
element.short: Creates a logical palette, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreatePalette.Result
element.short: The palette Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush
element.short: Creates a logical brush, selectable into any DC.

descr.p: The bitmap pattern is repeated for areas of larger width or height, it should allow for smooth transitions.
Monochrome bitmaps obtain the actual text (0) or background (1) color of the DC.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush.Result
element.short: The brush handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePatternBrush.ABitmap
element.short: The bitmap to use for the brush.

element.name: CreatePenIndirect
element.short: Creates an logical Pen, selectable into any DC.

element.name: CreatePenIndirect.Result
element.short: The pen Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn
element.short: Creates a polygonial region.
element.descr: The last point is connected to the first point, to close the region.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.Points
element.short: The array of points.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.NumPts
element.short: The number of points in Points.

element.name: CreatePolygonRgn.FillMode
element.short: Can be ALTERNATE or WINDING.

element.name: CreateRectRgn
element.short: Creates a rectangular region.

element.name: CreateRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn
element.short: Creates a rectangular region with rounded corners. All parameters in logical units.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.Result
element.short: The region Handle, zero on failure.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.nWidthEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: CreateRoundRectRgn.nHeightEllipse
element.short: The extent of the ellipse, used for the rounded corners.

element.name: DeleteCriticalSection
element.short: Deletes an unowned crititcal section.
element.errors: Results are unpredictable when the section is owned, i.e. has been entered but not yet left.

element.name: DeleteDC
element.short: Deletes an Device Context, created by CreateDC.

element.name: DeleteDC.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DeleteObject
element.short: Frees an GDI object.
element.descr: The bitmap of a pattern brush is not destroyed with the brush.
element.errors: The function fails when the Handle is selected into an DC.

element.name: DeleteObject.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCaret
element.short: Destroys the caret but doesn't free the bitmap.

element.name: DestroyCaret.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCaret.Handle
element.short: Handle of the window with the caret.

element.name: DestroyCursor
element.short: Destroys an mouse cursor.

element.name: DestroyCursor.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: DestroyCursor.Handle
element.short: The cursor Handle.

element.name: FrameRect
element.short: Draws the border of a rectangle with the brush.

element.name: GetClientRect
element.short: Returns the client rectangle of a control. Left and Top are always 0.

descr.p: The client rectangle is the size of the inner area of a control, where the child controls are visible.
A child control with Align=alClient will completely fill the clientrect.

element.name: GetScrollInfo
element.short: Returns all or selected information about a ScrollBar.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.Handle
element.short: The ScrollBar or window handle.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.SBStyle
element.short: The ScrollBar kind.

element.name: GetScrollInfo.ScrollInfo
element.short: Initialize ScrollInfo.fMask with the flags for the desired values.

element.name: GetWindowRect
element.short: After the call, ARect will be the control area in screen coordinates.
element.descr: That means, Left and Top will be the screen coordinates of the TopLeft pixel of the Handle object and Right and Bottom will be the screens coordinate of the BottomRight pixel.

element.name: GetWindowSize
element.short: Returns the Width and Height of the window.

element.name: IntersectClipRect
element.short: Shrinks the clipping region in an Device Context to the boundary defined by Left, Top, Right, Bottom.
element.descr:
The result can be one of the following constants:
Error NullRegion SimpleRegion ComplexRegion Region_Error

element.name: IntersectClipRect.Result
element.short: The region type, zero on failure.

element.name: PolyBezier
element.short: Draws Bzier curves
element.descr: Use Polybezier to draw cubic Bzier curves. The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point with the second and third points being the control points. If the Continuous flag is TRUE then each subsequent curve requires three more points, using the end-point of the previous Curve as its starting point, the first and second points being used as its control points, and the third point its end-point. If the continous flag is set to FALSE, then each subsequent Curve requires 4 additional points, which are used exactly as in the first curve. Any additonal points which do not add up to a full bezier(4 for Continuous, 3 otherwise) are ignored. There must be at least 4 points for an drawing to occur. If the Filled Flag is set to TRUE then the resulting Poly-Bzier will be drawn as a Polygon.

element.name: Polygon
element.short: Draws a Polygon
element.descr: Use Polygon to draw a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, using the value of Pen. After drawing the complete shape, Polygon fills the shape using the value of Brush. The Points parameter is an array of points that give the vertices of the polygon. Winding determines how the polygon is filled. When Winding is True, Polygon fills the shape using the Winding fill algorithm. When Winding is False, Polygon uses the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm. StartIndex gives the index of the first point in the array to use. All points before this are ignored. NumPts indicates the number of points to use, starting at StartIndex. If NumPts is -1 (the default), Polygon uses all points from StartIndex to the end of the array. The first point is always connected to the last point. To draw a polygon on the canvas, without filling it, use the Polyline method, specifying the first point a second time at the end.

element.name: Polyline
element.short: Draws a sequence of lines
element.descr: Use Polyline to connect a set of points on the canvas. If you specify only two points, Polyline draws a single line. The Points parameter is an array of points to be connected. StartIndex identifies the first point in the array to use. NumPts indicates the number of points to use. If NumPts is -1 (the default), PolyLine uses all the points from StartIndex to the end of the array. Calling the MoveTo function with the value of the first point, and then repeatedly calling LineTo with all subsequent points will draw the same image on the canvas. However, unlike LineTo, Polyline does not change the value of PenPos.

element.name: PostMessage
element.short: Sends a message directed to a window to the message pool of the application

descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages. These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the Handle parameter of this routine. Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER. The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: ReleaseDC
element.short: Releases an Device Context obtained by GetDC.

element.name: ReleaseDC.Result
element.short: Zero on failure.

element.name: ReleaseDC.hWnd
element.short: The window associated with the DC.

element.name: ScreenToClient
element.short: Converts absolute Screen coordinates into Client relative coordinates.

element.name: ScreenToClient.Result
element.short: False on failure.

element.name: ScreenToClient.Handle
element.short: The window with the client area.

element.name: ScreenToClient.P
element.short: The point to convert.

element.name: SendMessage
element.short: Sends a message directed to a window to the message pool of the application

descr.p: This method is a thread-safe solution to send messages to windows. Those messages will be handled in the message loop of the application and therefore can be sent from any thread. They are not immediate, but they will awake the main thread if it is waiting for messages. These messages can be handled by procedures with the keyword message in the class of a form for example. One would then use the handle of this form as the HandleWnd parameter of this routine. Custom messages should always have an identification number (represented by the parameter Msg) larger then the constant LM_USER. The two parameters WParam and LParam will be passed along to the window together with the Msg identification number.

The difference between SendMessage and PostMessage is the way that they return control to the calling thread. With SendMessage control is not returned until the window that the message was sent to has completed processing the sent message, however with PostMessage control is returned immediately.

element.name: SendMessage.HandleWnd
element.short: The handle of the window to receive the message.

element.name: SetWindowRgn
element.short: Defines the visible region of a window or control
element.descr: This function sets the visible region of a window or control. It's parameters are: hWnd - The handle of the window or control hRgn - The handle to the region which contains the visible section of the window or control bRedraw - True if the control or window should be repainted following the call of this function, false otherwise See also the wiki documentation: http://wiki.lazarus.freepascal.org/LCL_Tips#Creating_a_non-rectangular_window_or_control

element.name: EqualRect
element.short: Returns True when the rectangles are identical.

element.name: GetScrollPos
element.short: Returns the scollbar position.
element.descr: If the scrollbar is not visible, then the return value is 0.

element.name: GetScrollPos.Result
element.short: The position, zero if the scrollbar is not visible.

element.name: GetScrollRange
element.short: Returns the minimum and maximum Position values of a ScrollBar.

element.name: GetRValue
element.short: Extracts the red color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetGValue
element.short: Extracts the green color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetBValue
element.short: Extracts the blue color value from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetRGBValues
element.short: Extracts the red, green and blue color values from a COLORREF.

element.name: GetRGBIntValues
element.short: Extracts the red, green and blue color values from a COLORREF.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask
element.short: Converts an imagelist index into an overlay index.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask.Result
element.short: Ready for combination with another imagelist index.

element.name: IndexToOverlayMask.iOverlay
element.short: The imagelist index of the overlay.

element.name: InflateRect
element.short: Inflates the rectangle in all directions.

descr.p: The deltas are applied to every side, i.e. the width and height increase by the double amount.
Positive values inflate, negative values deflate.
The rectangle is clipped so that width and height never can become negative.
This method can be used to add or subtract a border around the rectangle.

element.name: InflateRect.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: InflateRect.ARect
element.short: This rectangle is modified.

element.name: InflateRect.dx
element.short: The horizontal increase, negative to decrease.

element.name: InflateRect.dy
element.short: The vertical increase, negative to decrease.

element.name: IntersectRect
element.short: Intersects SrcRect1 and SrcRect2 into DestRect.

descr.p: Intersecting means that DestRect will be the overlapping area of SrcRect1 and SrcRect2.
If SrcRect1 and SrcRect2 do not overlap the Result is false, else true.

element.name: IntersectRect.Result
element.short: False when the rectangles don't overlap.

element.name: IntersectRect.DestRect
element.short: Receives the intersection.

element.name: IsCharAlphaNumeric
element.short: Checks for ASCII letter or digit characters.

element.name: IsCharAlphaNumeric.Result
element.short: True when the character is a letter or digit.

element.name: IsRectEmpty
element.short: Returns True if the rectangle is empty.
element.descr: IsEmptyRect returns true if the area of the rectangle is empty, i.e. has a zero or negative width or height.

element.name: IsRectEmpty.Result
element.short: True if the rectangle is empty.

element.name: KillTimer
element.short: Removes an timer.

element.name: KillTimer.Result
element.short: Zero on failure!

element.name: KillTimer.Wnd
element.short: The window handle associated with the timer, can be zero.

element.name: KillTimer.uIDEvent
element.short: The timer ID.

element.name: MakeLong
element.short: Copies two words into a double word.

element.name: MakeLong.Result
element.short: The combined doubleword.

element.name: MakeLong.A
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLong.B
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeWord
element.short: Copies two bytes into a word.

element.name: MakeWord.A
element.short: The low byte.

element.name: MakeWord.B
element.short: The high byte.

element.name: MakeWParam
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message wParam.
element.descr: The result has the size of an pointer. Excess bits are sign extended[?].

element.name: MakeWParam.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeWParam.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeLParam
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message lParam.

element.name: MakeLParam.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLParam.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: MakeLResult
element.short: Copies two words into a double word, usable as a message Result.

element.name: MakeLResult.l
element.short: The low word.

element.name: MakeLResult.h
element.short: The high word.

element.name: OffSetRect
element.short: Move Left/Right by dx, Top/Bottom by dy. Return Top and Left are >= 0.

element.name: OffSetRect.Result
element.short: False if resulting Top or Left are negative.

element.name: PtInRect
element.short: Checks whether a Point is within a Rect.

descr.p: Top and Left side are part of the rectangle, but Bottom and Right side are outside.

element.name: PtInRect.Result
element.short: True when Point is within Rect.

element.name: RGB
element.short: Combines Red, Green and Blue values into an Color value.

descr.p: The bytes are shifted into place, for a standard COLORREF. Their physical order depends on the endianness of the machine.
Depending on the application and hardware, the color components may not be in the desired order. [see also?]

element.name: RGB.Result
element.short: The combined doubleword.

element.name: RGB.R
element.short: The low byte.

element.name: RGB.G
element.short: The mid byte (*16).

element.name: RGB.B
element.short: The high byte (*256).

element.name: ScrollWindow
element.short: Scrolls the content of a window, by a number of pixels.

element.name: ScrollWindow.XAmount
element.short: Horizontal distance (positive to scroll down)

element.name: ScrollWindow.YAmount
element.short: Vertical distance (positive to scroll right)

element.name: ScrollWindow.Rect
element.short: The part of the window, that is to be scrolled.

element.name: ScrollWindow.ClipRect
element.short: Pixels falling outside this rectangle are lost.

element.name: SetRect
element.short: Copies coordinates into a rectangle.

element.name: SetRect.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetRectEmpty
element.short: Clears the rectangle to all zero coordinates.

element.name: SetRectEmpty.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetScrollPos
element.short: Changes the Position of an ScrollBar slider.
element.descr: The SetScrollPos function sets the position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar and, if requested, redraws the scroll bar to reflect the new position of the scroll box.

element.name: SetScrollPos.Result
element.short: The previous Position, zero if invisible.

element.name: SetScrollPos.Handle
element.short: The ScrollBar or Window Handle.

element.name: SetScrollPos.nBar
element.short: SB_CTL means a ScrollBar control.

element.name: SetScrollPos.nPos
element.short: The new Position.

element.name: SetScrollPos.bRedraw
element.short: True forces a repaint.

element.name: SetScrollRange
element.short: Sets the minimum and maximum position values of an ScrollBar.

element.name: SetScrollRange.Result
element.short: Always True.

element.name: SetTimer
element.short: Creates or resets an timer for the given time interval.

descr.p: Every timer has a unique ID, which is reported in the timer message and can be used to reset or kill the timer.
When the time has elapsed, the callback procedure is invoked. If no procedure is given, a WM_TIMER message is sent to the window. If also no window is given, the function fails.
When the timer already exists, it is reset to the new interval.

element.name: SetTimer.Result
element.short: The timer ID, or zero on failure.

element.name: SetTimer.Wnd
element.short: The window associated with the timer.

element.name: SetTimer.nIDEvent
element.short: The ID of the timer, ignored when Wnd is zero.

element.name: SetTimer.uElapse
element.short: The time interval to wait.

element.name: SetTimer.lpTimerFunc
element.short: The callback procedure, can be Nil.

element.name: SmallPointToPoint
element.short: Converts an TSmallPoint into an TPoint.

element.name: SubtractRect
element.short: Computes the bounding box of the geometric difference of two rectangles.

descr.p: When the rectangles do not overlap completely in either x or y direction, the result is the first rectangle (lprcSrc1).
Otherwise the overlapping area is excluded from the first rectangle.
The bounding box is the rectangle that covers the entire resulting area.

element.name: SubtractRect.Result
element.short: False when the resulting rectangle is empty.

element.name: SubtractRect.lprcSrc2
element.short: The rectangle to subtract.

element.name: UnionRect
element.short: Computes the bounding box of the union of two rectangles.

descr.p: The bounding box is the rectangle that covers the entire resulting area. Here the result covers both rectangles.
The rectangles can be disjoint.
Rectangles with a zero or negative width or height are treated as empty rectangles (ignored).

element.name: UnionRect.Result
element.short: False when the resulting rectangle is empty, i.e. when both source rectangles are empty.

element.name: OpenURL
element.short: Open a given URL with the default browser
element.descr: The function uses FindDefaultBrowser to find the default browser. If it can be found it starts it and returns true. The AURL is passed as parameter. AURL must be an URL like http://www.lazarus.freepascal.org or file:///tmp/test.txt or file://C:\test.txt.
